sense.name: the people who are the administrative agents
sense.commentary: GOVERNMENT[+entity][+group][+person][+administrator][+political] Note: refers to the people who administrate, not the system of rules (Sense 2)
sense.examples: The new liberal government is likely to advocate raising taxes. The government has not yet decided whether to recognize that nation.

sense.name: political system of enforceable rules
sense.commentary: GOVERNMENT[+system][+rule][+political][+enforceable] The system of rules by which a community is governed, not the people who administrate (Sense 1)
sense.examples: A stable economic situation is necessary for the existence of democratic governments. It was a tyrannical government in which the citizens had no property rights and no voting rights.

sense.name: the act of governing, administrating
sense.commentary: GOVERNMENT[+event][+activity][+regulatory][+political] The act of exercising authority, administrating Note: X's government of Y -> X governs Y (nominalization
sense.examples: That nation's government of its outlying territories is becoming more difficult over time. He will assume the government of the infirmary for at least six months.

sense.name: the study of political rules and systems
sense.commentary: GOVERNMENT[+entity][+symbolic][+domain][+knowledge][+political_rule] The study of government and other political units
sense.examples: The curriculum includes courses in economics, government and history. He is a professor of government at the university.

sense.name: federal financial bonds
sense.commentary: GOVERNMENT[+entity][+artifact][+financial][+debt][+bond][+federal] Note: often occurs in the plural
sense.examples: John bought municipals and governments as part of his financial portfolio.

sense.name: linguistic relation of subordination of one constituent to another
sense.examples: Noam Chomsky has advocated a theory of government and binding between linguistic constituents.

sense.name: shishkebob of Sense 1 and Sense 2
sense.commentary: Choose this sense, if you think both Sense 1 and Sense 2 could apply.
sense.examples: Government forces may intervene in this situation. (Could be people, agents, and/or rules regulations) This government agency is under investigation. (could be the people, and/or the rules and policies of it.)
